content: big splash written and designed by yvonne van zijl @bokkyshome 2023 this pattern was designed in 2021 and then got lost in the digital jungle that is in my ipad the crocheted version ended up on the see-you-later-pile in my craftroom where i ignored it for 2 years recently i found the pdf version of the pattern in that mentioned jungle and it looked so pitiful let s just say that my writing skills have improved since then what we have here is the re-written cleaned up version the first big splash was crocheted in blues and white and reminded me of a big splash hence the name the 7-colored version looks more like a big boom the white version reminded me that with mosaic using contrasting colors is essential i tested my own pattern one more time that resulted in the stained glass look the pattern got some minor adjustments along the way the photos for the stained glass look are used in this pattern i hope you enjoy making your big splash © big splash by yvonne van zijl @bokkyshome 2023 1 terminology us terms skill level advanced basic knowledge of overlay mosaic crochet and tapestry crochet is required fpedc3tog should not scare you off yardage 330-360 m when crocheted on hook size 4 mm finished size version 1 41 cm versions 2 - 4 37 cm no swatch needed material version 1 scheepjes colorcrafter 330 m versions 2-4 durable comfy 360 m crochet hook size 4 mm a darning needle a pair of scissors depending on your project a metal hoop an inner pillow a zipper or handles colors use at least 3 colors of your choice for your big splash i have added a chart on pages 3 and 4 defining the yarn and colors that i used for my first 3 versions sadly i did not take notes on yardage for the 7-color version the colors used for the stained glass version version 4 are mentioned as a b and c throughout the pattern colors and yardage used for version 4 color a - 308 pastel yellow 70 g/185 m color b - 412 phantom 50 g/133 m color c - 203 light pink 20 g/53 m to make writing simpler i used bold and blue writing where more than 1 color was used in a round ignore this change in writing if you are using less colors or only 1 color in a round where more colors are used in a round the 1st color mentioned is the color to start the round with this is essential to know which color to pull through in the closing slip_stitch of the previous round © big splash by yvonne van zijl @bokkyshome 2023 2 1 scheepjes colorcrafter 2 durable comfy 3 durable comfy a bastogne 180 m a1 2136 bright mint a 326 ivory 200 m b weert 105 m a2 419 orchid b 419 orchid 120 m c urk 45 m a3 203 light pink
